lexUnit.name: skirt.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: go around or past the edge of

sentence.text: She collected her jacket then crept downstairs on noiseless , rubber-soled feet , taking extra care as she skirted the study on her way out .
Solid and secret behind a high stone wall it remains a world apart from the crawling traffic which skirts it on the routes out of town .

As they skirted the smooth lawns on the way back to the car park Merrill dropped behind to walk with Sam who was now complacently asserting that all this exercise had given him an appetite for dinner .
He skirted the house to the rear , but guards were also there .
We collected our horses from the tavern and decided to skirt the city .
We skirt an abyss-like hole , narrowly avoid a rock , then another wall of water rears up in front of me , blocking out the sky .
For the rest of the day we skirted a large swamp ; that night the mosquitoes were particularly bad .
As they skirted the forest and came out on to a stretch of road fringed by slender copper beeches , Fenella had the feeling of something deep and ancient and strong moving all about them .
The next day also , Ian would take the bus to Lima which skirted Sendero territory .
Stirling had originally intended to skirt south of the salt marshes and then find a way through the mountains to Gafsa where American forces had been reported , but changed his mind .
He skirted over the small matter that he was one of them .
Calmly and methodically , Kirov climbed from the driving seat and skirted round to the back of the van , opening the rear door .
If you stop here we can skirt round the fence . "
